nodes.text:
Lady Arano. My staff has taken Lady Espinosa into custody; she is being escorted to her cell as we speak.

A kinder fate than she deserves, perhaps… but I will adhere to the terms of our arrangement. While she remains in my custody, she will not be harmed.
You are an honorable man, Lord Karosas. One day, I hope to earn your support.

You already have it. What you've done today feels like justice, Lady Arano. Of a kind I never thought I'd live to see. I owe you a debt of thanks as well, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. You did a yeoman's job on the Newgrange—she will never darken our skies again.

branches.responseText: Lady Victoria claims that you were wrong, Lord Karosas. That the Newgrange wasn't a smuggling ship.
If I were you, I'd make sure to keep an armed guard outside Victoria's cell at all times. She'll be dangerous, even in captivity.
Glad to be of service. Now let's discuss what you'll be doing for us in return.

nodes.text:
Of course she does. She's a liar and a betrayer.

You can't trust her at her word, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Origin: Betrayed]</color> Believe me, Lord Karosas, I get that. I understand betrayal better than most.
Play devil's advocate. What if she's telling the truth?
True enough. Forget I said anything.

nodes.text: That said: even if Lady Victoria was telling the truth, would it really change anything? Whatever the ship's provenance, the Newgrange was important enough that Director Espinosa had his own daughter standing sentry over her refueling site. You sent the Newgrange to hell, and deprived Espinosa of something he deemed valuable. I count that as a win, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.

It doesn't matter if she is. Whatever the ship's provenance, the Newgrange was important enough that Director Espinosa had his own daughter standing sentry over her refueling site. You sent that ship to hell and deprived Espinosa of something he deemed valuable. I count that as a win, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.
I don't blame you for taking her words at face value. The Espinosas can be quite convincing when it suits them.

Don't worry, Commander. I know who I'm dealing with, and the appropriate precautions have been taken.

Lady Victoria will be quite secure until Lady Arano is ready to reclaim her.

Yes, of course. Let us discuss your recompense.

Your chief engineer tells me that she's found a hidden data archive on from a crashed ship, and that you need my help to open it. It sounds to be quite the mystery.

More than a mystery to me, Lord Karosas. My father believed that the Scheria held something of great value, but he died before he could see it. I need to know what's on that drive. And you're the only one in the Reach who can open it for me.

Better, perhaps, that I give you the means to open it yourself.

I will have a device sent to your ship. An [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAdvancedElectronicCodebreaker],electronic codebreaker]] of advanced design. Given enough time, it'll chew through any encryption—even yours.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Deep Periphery]</color> With respect, I'm surprised that a Periphery lord even has access to such a device.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Rimward Periphery]</color> With respect, I'm surprised that a Periphery lord even has access to such a device.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Free Worlds League]</color> With respect, I'm surprised that you own such a device. An intelligence agency like SAFE, perhaps… but not a Periphery lord.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Federated Suns]</color> With respect, I'm surprised that you own such a device. An intelligence agency like MI3, perhaps... but not a Periphery lord.

<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Draconis Combine]</color> With respect, I'm surprised that you own such a device. An intelligence agency like the Order of the Five Pillars, perhaps… but not a Periphery lord.

<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Lyran Commonwealth]</color> With respect, I'm surprised that you own such a device. An intelligence agency like the Lyran Intelligence Corps, perhaps… but not a Periphery lord.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Capellan Confederation]</color> With respect, I'm surprised that you own such a device. An intelligence agency like the Maskirovka, perhaps… but not a Periphery lord.
And you're just going to give this to us?
That's a hell of a toy, Lord Karosas.

nodes.text:
I was just as surprised when I received it. [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHighLordTamatiArano],High Lord Tamati]] himself delivered it to me.

He told me that it had been discovered in the possession of a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreComStarPrecentor],ComStar Precentor]] who had died in Aurigan space. What she was doing with it, I will never know.

I felt the same way when [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHighLordTamatiArano],High Lord Tamati]] brought it to me, all those many years ago.

He told me that the device had been found in the possession of a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreComStarPrecentor],ComStar Precentor]] who had died in Aurigan space. What she was doing with it, I will never know.
What I do know is that your father would want you to have this, Kamea. He'd be quite proud of the leader you've become.

I have no need of it… but the Restoration does. And besides, it came to me from Lady Arano's father. [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHighLordTamatiArano],High Lord Tamati]] found the device in the possession of a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreComStarPrecentor],ComStar Precentor]] who had died in Aurigan space.

He'd want you to have this, Kamea. He'd be quite proud of the leader you've become.

Quite. Lady Arano's father found it in the possession of a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreComStarPrecentor],ComStar Precentor]] who had died in Aurigan space. What she was doing with it, I will never know. What I do know is that [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHighLordTamatiArano],High Lord Tamati]] would want you to have this, Kamea. He'd be quite proud of the leader you've become.

Thank you, Lord Karosas—Simon. It means more to me than I can say.

Speaking of proud fathers, do you have any news to share about your son? Has his condition improved since last we spoke?

Somewhat, my lady. Otto's road to recovery will be long and difficult. The Directorate did something to his mind on Weldry… I still don't have a clear picture of what. But the damage is both physical and mental. In truth, I fear that my boy has been damaged irreparably, and that the Otto I knew is gone. But I cling to the hope that someday, the son that I remember will return to me.

He will, Simon—I know it. Otto is young and strong, and House Karosas is nothing if not resilient.

I'm afraid that I must take my leave of you now—I have forces to marshal and plans to make. But please keep me apprised of Otto's condition.

I will, my lady. Farewell to you, and know that you have earned the support of [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHouseKarosas],House Karosas]]. 

What you've done today doesn't erase the past… but perhaps we can still right the course of our people's future. For my part, I am willing to try.
Thank you, Lord Karosas—and welcome to the Restoration. Together, we will fix what my uncle has broken. I swear it.
